study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate and compare right ventricular (RV) and left ventricular (LV) extracellular volumes (ECVs) using iodine density derived from spectral CT in patients with chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH).
results_summary: The study found that untreated CTEPH patients had significantly higher RV and LV ECVs compared to treated patients and controls, suggesting iodine-derived spectral CT can effectively assess myocardial fibrosis.
population_specificity: 31 patients with CTEPH (17 untreated, 14 treated) and 8 control subjects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the best surgical techniques to reduce the incidence of Frey syndrome (FS) after parotidectomy, using iodine in the starch-iodine test as an objective measure.
results_summary: The study found that temporoparietal fascia (TPFF), acellular dermal matrix (ADM), and free fat graft (FFG) techniques significantly reduced both subjective and objective FS incidence compared to no treatment. All treatments showed significant reductions in objective FS incidence, with TPFF, ADM, and FFG being the most effective.
population_specificity: 3830 patients with a median age of 50.35 years undergoing parotidectomy.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (surgical techniques evaluated, not iodine dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between antithyroid drugs (including iodine-related compounds) and ethylenethiourea with thyroid cancer incidence or mortality in humans.
results_summary: The study found no conclusive evidence linking antithyroid drugs or ethylenethiourea to thyroid cancer, with some reports showing no deaths from thyroid cancer in patients treated exclusively with antithyroid drugs and no association detected in case-control studies.
population_specificity: Patients treated for hyperthyroidism (1946-1964), workers occupationally exposed to ethylenethiourea, and farmers exposed to mancozeb.
study_duration: Follow-up periods ranged up to 2014 in some studies.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the potential of combining monoclonal antibodies with PET imaging (ImmunoPET) for improved tumor detection, but the abstract does not specifically address iodine.
results_summary: The abstract discusses ImmunoPET as a promising imaging modality but does not provide results related to iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on general tumor imaging applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of alcohol-based povidone-iodine (PVP-I-ALC) versus alcohol-based chlorhexidine (CHG-ALC) in reducing aerobic and anaerobic skin flora, particularly Cutibacterium acnes, during shoulder surgery preparation.
results_summary: PVP-I-ALC showed marginal benefits over CHG-ALC in reducing aerobic flora and more substantial benefits in reducing anaerobic flora, particularly at immediate sampling points. No adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: 16 healthy volunteers
effective_dosage: Alcohol-based povidone-iodine (PVP-I-ALC) applied for 2.5 min (standard) or 30 min (prolonged)
study_duration: Single application with immediate and 3-hour follow-up sampling

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy of different povidone iodine concentrations (0.5%, 1%, and 3%) for managing postoperative pain and swelling after mandibular third molar surgery.
results_summary: All three povidone iodine concentrations significantly reduced postoperative trismus compared to saline controls, with 1% and 3% concentrations showing greater effectiveness up to 7 days post-surgery. The 3% concentration was most effective in reducing facial swelling.
population_specificity: Individuals aged 18-30 years undergoing surgical removal of pathology-free, completely unerupted mandibular third molars.
effective_dosage: 0.5%, 1%, and 3% povidone iodine concentrations (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Assessments were made on the 2nd and 7th postoperative days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of COVID-19 on endonasal neurosurgical practices, including the use of a nasal iodine wash as a risk mitigation strategy.
results_summary: The study found that preoperative screening and operative modifications, including the use of a nasal iodine wash, were associated with no COVID-19 infections or mortality in the cohort. No specific adverse effects from iodine were reported.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing endonasal neurosurgical procedures (n=124) in the UK and Ireland during the COVID-19 pandemic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of spectral CT datasets (including iodine maps) versus conventional CT datasets for automatic liver lesion localization and classification using machine learning.
results_summary: Spectral CT data, particularly 40 keV virtual monochromatic images, outperformed conventional CT in both lesion localization (smaller distance errors) and classification (higher accuracy). The study concluded that combining spectral CT with machine learning could enhance diagnostic accuracy.
population_specificity: Patients with known liver diagnoses (healthy, cyst, hypodense metastasis) from clinical reports.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether subcutaneous tissue disinfection with povidone-iodine solution could reduce the Cutibacterium acnes culture rate during primary open shoulder surgery.
results_summary: Subcutaneous disinfection with povidone-iodine significantly reduced the positive culture rate for all germs combined and specifically for C. acnes, including on surgical gloves and retractors. The study recommends this step to limit iatrogenic contamination.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary open shoulder surgery via a deltopectoral approach.
effective_dosage: Not specified (povidone-iodine solution used for subcutaneous disinfection).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the virucidal efficacy of povidone iodine (PVP-I) against COVID-19 in the nasopharynx and assess its safety.
results_summary: The abstract describes the study design and protocol but does not report results or efficacy outcomes.
population_specificity: RT-PCR-confirmed COVID-19 patients aged 15-90 years with symptoms for the past 4 days, excluding those with specific contraindications.
effective_dosage: 0.4%, 0.5%, and 0.6% PVP-I for nasal irrigation; 0.5% and 0.6% PVP-I for nasal spray.
study_duration: Outcomes assessed from 1 minute to 15 minutes post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of selenium (not iodine) in endocrine system regulation, including its effects on thyroid function, glucoregulatory hormones, and other endocrine pathways.
results_summary: The abstract discusses selenium's impact on endocrine functions, including thyroid hormone regulation, male fertility, and conditions like diabetes and osteoporosis, but does not provide specific findings about iodine.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of endocrine-related effects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of visual inspection with acetic acid and Lugol iodine (VIA/VILI) as a screening modality for cervical cancer in rural areas of China.
results_summary: The study found that hrHPV testing with cytology triage reduced colposcopy referral rates and improved CIN2+ yields compared to VIA/VILI in rural areas. However, the abstract does not provide specific results on the efficacy or safety of iodine itself.
population_specificity: Women aged 35 to 64 years in rural and urban areas of China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the advantages of dual-energy CT (DECT) over conventional single-energy CT (SECT) for gastrointestinal imaging, including the use of iodine maps for improved lesion detection and disease characterization.
results_summary: The study highlights that DECT, through energy- and material-specific reconstructions, enables retrospective image quality adjustments, potentially avoiding patient recalls. Iodine maps, combined with low-energy monochromatic and virtual unenhanced images, can enhance lesion detection and disease characterization in gastrointestinal imaging.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing gastrointestinal imaging (liver, gallbladder, pancreas, and bowel).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate advancements in the management of differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including the role of radioactive iodine (radioiodine) in treatment and follow-up strategies.
results_summary: The study highlights improved diagnostic tools and prognostic classifications for DTC, noting that low-risk patients have excellent outcomes, while high-risk patients require aggressive treatment. Radioactive iodine is part of the therapeutic approach, but the abstract does not detail its specific efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), categorized as low-risk, intermediate-risk, or high-risk.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of thyroid disorders (hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism) and their treatments on pregnancy outcomes, including maternal and fetal health.
results_summary: The study found that untreated hypothyroidism is associated with adverse obstetric and neurodevelopmental outcomes, while overt hypothyroidism should be treated with levothyroxine (LT4) to maintain TSH <2.5 mIU/L. Antithyroid medications like propylthiouracil and methimazole have teratogenic risks, with propylthiouracil being preferred in the first trimester.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age, particularly those with thyroid disorders during pregnancy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of laser-assisted drug delivery of onabotulinum toxin A (BoNTA) and intradermal BoNTA injections for treating palmar hyperhidrosis, not iodine.
results_summary: The study found that laser-assisted delivery of 75 units of BoNTA was clinically equivalent to 50 units of intradermal injections, with significantly lower pain intensity on the laser-treated side. Iodine was only used as part of the starch test for evaluation, not as a treatment.
population_specificity: 30 adult patients with idiopathic palmar hyperhidrosis.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (iodine was not a treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of povidone-iodine (PVP-I) in managing chronic wounds and biofilms, comparing its efficacy and safety with polyhexanide (PHMB) and silver.
results_summary: PVP-I demonstrated a broader spectrum of antimicrobial activity, potent antibiofilm efficacy, no bacterial resistance, low cytotoxicity, good tolerability, and an ability to promote wound healing compared to PHMB and silver.
population_specificity: Chronic wound patients with biofilm-infiltrated or critically colonised wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of povidone-iodine (PI) mouth-rinse in reducing salivary SARS-CoV-2 viral load in COVID-19 patients compared to other mouth-rinses and water.
results_summary: PI mouth-rinse showed a significant increase in Ct value fold change at the 6-hour time point compared to water, indicating sustained reduction in viral load. No significant differences were observed at earlier time points (5 min and 3 h).
population_specificity: 36 SARS-CoV-2-positive patients, with 4 in the PI group.
study_duration: Saliva samples collected at baseline, 5 min, 3 h, and 6 h post-application.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of oral health care (OHC) interventions, including potential use of iodine-based solutions, with usual care or other treatments for maintaining oral health in stroke survivors.
results_summary: The study found low- to very low-quality evidence suggesting OHC interventions, possibly including iodine, improved denture cleanliness and knowledge/attitudes toward oral care, but limited evidence for reducing pneumonia or improving natural teeth cleanliness.
population_specificity: People with physical, sensory, or cognitive limitations due to stroke receiving assisted oral health care.
study_duration: Varied by trial; one-month follow-up mentioned for some outcomes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the viability of long-term anti-thyroid drugs (ATD) as an alternative to ablative therapies (radioiodine or surgery) for managing Graves' disease.
results_summary: Long-term ATD was found to maintain euthyroidism with minimal complications, low financial cost, and improved quality of life compared to ablative therapies. It offers advantages across multiple patient-centered outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease who failed to achieve remission after standard ATD therapy (12-18 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of preoperative intranasal povidone-iodine in reducing surgical site infections (SSIs) by reviewing existing literature.
results_summary: The review identified limited controlled clinical studies (5 total) supporting the use of intranasal povidone-iodine for reducing bacterial colonization and SSIs, with one study showing enhanced effectiveness when combined with chlorhexidine gluconate washcloths. Further large-scale studies are needed for definitive guidelines.
population_specificity: Patients planned for surgery (preoperative decontamination focus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various treatment strategies, including RFA combined with iodine-125, on overall and recurrence-free survival in early-stage hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: The study found that RFA combined with iodine-125 ranked highest for both recurrence-free survival (HR: 0.50) and overall survival (HR: 0.41), with particularly marked benefits in solitary HCC cases (HR: 0.21 for OS).
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), including those with solitary HCC.
study_duration: Median follow-up ranged from 12-93 months (intervention duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a case of probable contrast-induced encephalopathy (CIE) following the use of an iodine-based contrast agent (iopromide) during coronary angiography.
results_summary: The study found that a low dose of iopromide (20 mL) caused severe neurotoxic symptoms, including unconsciousness, hemiparesis, seizures, and cardiac/respiratory arrest in an elderly patient. Treatment with rehydration, anticonvulsants, and dexamethasone led to full recovery.
population_specificity: 84-year-old woman undergoing diagnostic coronary angiography.
study_duration: Immediate effects observed within minutes to hours post-procedure; recovery took 3 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the applications of iodine-DECT mapping in diagnosing and monitoring inflammatory lesions and therapeutic effects in rheumatology.
results_summary: Iodine-DECT mapping improves delineation of inflammatory lesions like capsulitis and tenosynovitis and offers a promising objective method for assessing therapeutic effects in inflammatory arthritis. However, sensitivity decreases with deeper tissues, and trained readers are required for accurate interpretation.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory joint diseases, such as gout and inflammatory arthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether iodine ointment reduces the biofilm area in pressure ulcers with critical colonization.
results_summary: The study found that iodine ointment significantly reduced the proportion of biofilm area in pressure ulcers after one week compared to treatments without iodine. The standardized partial regression coefficient indicated a meaningful effect of iodine ointment on biofilm reduction.
population_specificity: 34 patients with pressure ulcers deeper than the dermis and in a state of critical colonization.

study_goal: The researchers compared the antiseptic efficacy of povidone-iodine-5% alcohol versus 2% alcoholic chlorhexidine in preventing bacterial colonization of perineural catheters in orthopedic surgery.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine-5% alcohol was less effective than 2% alcoholic chlorhexidine in reducing bacterial colonization of perineural catheters (32.7% vs. 15.5%). No catheter-related infections or adverse effects were observed with either antiseptic.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing orthopedic surgery with perineural catheters.
study_duration: Duration of catheter use varied, with ≥3 days identified as a risk factor for colonization.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of iodine intake or supplementation on breast cancer progression, focusing on antiproliferative, cell-cycle arrest, and antimetastatic effects.
results_summary: A pilot study with molecular iodine showed favorable overall survival and disease-free interval in breast cancer, though most in vitro effects did not translate consistently to animal or human studies.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients (specific details not provided in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review two novel approaches (transoral endoscopic thyroid surgery and radiofrequency ablation) for treating autonomously functioning thyroid nodules (AFTNs) as alternatives to traditional treatments.
results_summary: The abstract presents a review of two new treatment options for AFTNs but does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects. It highlights the limitations of current treatments (anti-thyroidal medications, radioactive iodine, or surgery) and the risks of untreated hyperthyroidism.
population_specificity: Adults with benign thyroid nodules, specifically those with toxic or autonomously functioning thyroid nodules (AFTNs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) in the treatment and follow-up of differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and its impact on prognosis.
results_summary: The study found that RAI is administered post-thyroidectomy in DTC patients, but some cancer cells lose iodide uptake capability during progression, making them refractory to RAI and worsening prognosis. Advances in molecular pathways and kinase inhibitors offer potential therapeutic alternatives.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and medullary thyroid cancer (MTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Lugol's iodine staining in endoscopic screening for esophageal cancer detection in high-risk and non-high-risk areas in China.
results_summary: The study found higher detection and early-detection rates of esophageal and gastric cancers in high-risk areas using Lugol's iodine staining, with early-detection rates of 92.9% in the esophagus and 81.5% in the stomach. The method was more effective in high-risk areas compared to non-high-risk areas.
population_specificity: Eligible subjects from high-risk and non-high-risk areas in China, totaling 149,956 participants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether sufficient evidence exists for a causal relationship between periodontal microbes (including iodine-based interventions like povidone iodine) and respiratory diseases such as HAP and VAP.
results_summary: The study found insufficient evidence for the use of povidone iodine in reducing respiratory infections like VAP or HAP, with limitations noted in consistency and application. Chlorhexidine gluconate showed some efficacy for VAP, but iodine-based interventions lacked supporting data.
population_specificity: High-risk patients in hospitals, nursing homes, or long-term care facilities, particularly ventilated patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of iodine (povidone-iodine) in oral rinses to disrupt the SARS-CoV-2 lipid envelope and reduce viral transmission.
results_summary: The study suggests that povidone-iodine, among other mouthwash components, may disrupt the SARS-CoV-2 lipid envelope based on existing research on other enveloped viruses, warranting further clinical evaluation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of potential application in COVID-19 transmission reduction).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of nutrition education intervention on knowledge, attitude, and practice (KAP) of iodine deficiency and iodized salt utilization among women of reproductive age in Ethiopia.
results_summary: The study found that community-based iodine nutrition education significantly improved knowledge, attitude, and practice scores regarding iodine deficiency and iodized salt use, with statistically significant mean differences in the intervention group compared to controls.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age (652 participants) in southwest Ethiopia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of topical iodine/steroids versus antibiotics/steroids in treating acute to subacute adenoviral keratoconjunctivitis.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in acute signs, symptoms, or viral load between the iodine/steroid and antibiotic/steroid groups. However, iodine/steroid therapy significantly reduced the incidence of multiple subepithelial corneal infiltrates (MSI) during the subacute phase.
population_specificity: Nineteen patients with unilateral or bilateral adenoviral conjunctivitis diagnosed within less than 1 week from onset.
effective_dosage: Sixfold dilution of polyvinyl alcohol iodine (PAI) solution with 0.1% fluorometholone, administered four times a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare patient pain scores, ocular surface characteristics, and antimicrobial efficacy between povidone-iodine 5% and aqueous chlorhexidine 0.1% during intravitreal injections.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine caused greater ocular discomfort and corneal epitheliopathy compared to aqueous chlorhexidine, but both showed similar antimicrobial efficacy and no difference in adverse events. No cases of endophthalmitis occurred.
population_specificity: 50 patients (100 eyes) receiving same-day bilateral intravitreal anti-VEGF injections, mean age 68 years, 60% male.
study_duration: Immediate effects assessed 1 minute after instillation and 1 day post-procedure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the epidemiology and pathophysiology of amiodarone-induced thyroid disorders, focusing on clinical presentations and personalized management.
results_summary: The study found that amiodarone, due to its high iodine content, can impair thyroid function, causing hypothyroidism or thyrotoxicosis in ~20% of patients, with potential direct cytotoxicity from the drug or its metabolite.
population_specificity: Patients administered amiodarone (susceptible individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of robotic surgery versus open surgery for thyroid neoplasms.
results_summary: Robotic surgery was associated with longer operative duration, less lymph node retrieval, higher postoperative thyroglobulin levels, similar complication rates, less blood loss, better functional recovery, and higher cosmetic satisfaction compared to open surgery.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid neoplasms

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the iodine status of the Tibetan population and its association with thyroid dysfunction.
results_summary: The study found that iodine status in Tibetan adults was generally adequate, with 63.0% having urine iodine concentrations (UICs) within the optimal range (100-300 µg/L). However, 30.4% had UICs below 100 µg/L (indicating deficiency), and 9.6% had UICs above 300 µg/L (indicating excess). Thyroid disorders were more prevalent in women than men.
population_specificity: 1499 healthy adults from three areas of varying altitudes in Tibet.
effective_dosage: Not specified (measured existing iodine levels, not administered).
study_duration: Data collected from September 2016 to August 2018 (observational, no intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of iodine-impregnated drapes in preventing surgical site infections (SSIs) in groin incisions following vascular surgical procedures.
results_summary: The study reviewed various preventive strategies, including iodine-impregnated drapes, but did not isolate iodine's specific efficacy. The abstract suggests that targeting modifiable risk factors, including iodine-based interventions, may reduce SSI incidence.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing lower extremity vascular procedures, particularly those involving groin incisions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the safety and effectiveness of intraluminal brachytherapy combined with iodine for treating biliary obstruction caused by locally advanced pancreatic cancer.
results_summary: The procedure was successfully performed in 21 out of 22 patients (95.5%), with one failure due to an impassable obstruction. The study suggests potential effectiveness but lacks detailed outcome data.
population_specificity: Patients with biliary obstruction caused by locally advanced, nonmetastatic pancreatic cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of a 10% povidone-iodine solution in decontaminating dropped autologous bone fragments while maintaining cellular viability.
results_summary: The study found that a 5-minute bath in 10% povidone-iodine solution followed by a 1-minute saline lavage effectively decontaminated bone fragments and preserved cellular viability, with Staphylococcus epidermidis being the most common contaminant.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgical procedures where autologous bone fragments were used.
effective_dosage: 10% povidone-iodine solution for 5 minutes, followed by normal saline lavage for 1 minute.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between iodine intake and thyroglobulin (Tg) levels, as well as Tg's role as an indicator of thyroid stabilization and treatment success.
results_summary: The study found that Tg levels negatively correlate with iodine intake in healthy populations but increase with excessive intake, following a U-shaped curve. Elevated Tg is associated with thyroid diseases like hyperthyroidism and goiter, and effective treatment reduces Tg below 20 µg/l.
population_specificity: Populations without thyroid disease and patients with thyroid diseases (hyperthyroidism, goiter).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate iodine intake and status in lactating mother-infant pairs at 3 months postpartum and assess maternal iodine knowledge and practice.
results_summary: Maternal iodine intake was suboptimal (58% below EAR), with median UIC indicating deficiency. Women using iodine-containing supplements had significantly higher UIC and BMIC, and their infants had higher UIC. Iodine knowledge was low (66% had no/low knowledge) but predicted supplement use.
population_specificity: Breastfeeding mother-infant pairs in New Zealand at 3 months postpartum.
effective_dosage: Not specified (iodine intake estimated via diet diary; supplement use noted but dosage not detailed).
study_duration: Cross-sectional assessment at 3 months postpartum (no intervention duration specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss the production, properties, and applications of radioiodines in nuclear medicine.
results_summary: The abstract mentions the versatility of iodine-based imaging and theragnostic agents but does not provide specific findings on their effects.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of iodine (I-125) applicators in brachytherapy for treating uveal melanoma, comparing its efficacy and application with other radionuclides and therapeutic methods.
results_summary: The study highlights iodine (I-125) as a dominant radionuclide for brachytherapy in the USA, emphasizing its role in achieving local tumor control while preserving the eyeball and visual function. It notes the potential for serious radiation complications but does not specifically detail iodine's safety or efficacy relative to other treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with uveal melanoma, particularly those in the USA where iodine (I-125) applicators are commonly used.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate prenatal risk factors, including iodine tablet intake, associated with anorectal malformations (ARM).
results_summary: The study found that ARM mothers had a significantly higher intake of iodine tablets compared to the control group, but the abstract does not clarify whether this was beneficial or harmful. No direct efficacy outcomes for iodine were reported.
population_specificity: Mothers of infants with anorectal malformations (ARM) and a control group of mothers with healthy infants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost-effectiveness of radioactive iodine ablation dosing with or without diagnostic whole-body scans in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer post-thyroidectomy.
results_summary: Empiric radioactive iodine dosing was more cost-effective, yielding 0.94 more quality-adjusted life-years and costing $1250.07 less than management with diagnostic whole-body scans. Sensitivity analyses supported these findings unless there was a large discrepancy in ablation success rates between the two approaches.
population_specificity: Patients with well-differentiated thyroid cancer undergoing post-thyroidectomy ablation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of diagnostic imaging, including late iodine enhancement CT, in distinguishing cardiac complications (e.g., myocardial infarction, myocarditis) in COVID-19 patients with suspected cardiac involvement.
results_summary: The study highlights the utility of multimodality imaging, including late iodine enhancement CT, to detect cardiac injury and differentiate between conditions like myocardial infarction, myocarditis, and pulmonary embolism in COVID-19 patients. It emphasizes echocardiography as a first-line tool, with CT and MRI providing additional diagnostic clarity.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients with suspected cardiac involvement (e.g., elevated troponin levels, electrocardiographic changes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a novel diabody (PEG-AVP0458) targeting tumor-associated glycoprotein 72 (TAG-72) for improved pharmacokinetics and tumor bioavailability.
results_summary: The study reported the preclinical and clinical translation of PEG-AVP0458, leading to a first-in-human clinical trial of the diabody, but no specific results regarding iodine were mentioned.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus was on preclinical and clinical translation of a diabody).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility of a randomized controlled trial comparing the efficacy of surgical site irrigation with povidone-iodine versus sterile saline in reducing bacterial contamination before wound closure in pediatric posterior spine fusion.
results_summary: Positive culture rates were similar between povidone-iodine and sterile saline groups both before and after irrigation, with no significant reduction in bacterial contamination. Infection rates at 30 days were low and similar across treatment groups.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients undergoing posterior spine fusion, categorized as low-risk or high-risk for infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of radiation exposure, including iodine-131, on thyroid function, focusing on hypothyroidism, thyroid autoimmunity, and cancer risk.
results_summary: The study found that radiation exposure, including iodine-131, can cause hypothyroidism, thyroid cancer, and benign nodules, with dose thresholds varying by exposure type and age. Children are more sensitive, with hypothyroidism occurring at lower doses (3-5 Gy) compared to adults (10-50 Gy).
population_specificity: Radiation-exposed individuals, including atomic bomb survivors, Chernobyl accident victims, and patients treated with external beam radiotherapy or iodine-131.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose thresholds mentioned: 3-5 Gy for children, 10-50 Gy for adults).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 0.5% boric acid (BA) irrigant versus 0.1% povidone iodine (PVP-I) irrigant as adjuncts to scaling and root planing (SRP) in treating chronic periodontitis (CP).
results_summary: Both BA 0.5% and PVP-I 0.1% significantly improved periodontal parameters, bacterial levels, and oral neutrophil counts. BA 0.5% showed superior results in reducing gingival index (GI), bleeding on probing (BOP), and probing depth (PD) and clinical attachment level (CAL) for moderately deep pockets compared to PVP-I 0.1%.
population_specificity: 36 patients with chronic periodontitis from the Faculty of Odonto-Stomatology, University of Medicine and Pharmacy, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.
study_duration: Evaluations at baseline, 4, 6, and 8 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify pretreatment prognostic indicators, including platelet levels, to predict outcomes in postoperative papillary thyroid cancer patients undergoing radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment.
results_summary: Lower pretreatment platelet levels were associated with poor prognosis in PTC patients. The study also found differences in neutrophil levels, platelet subgroups, and a combined metric of red blood cell distribution width and BMI between prognosis groups.
population_specificity: 705 postoperative papillary thyroid cancer patients (211 males, 494 females).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of topical fluoride-antibacterial agent combined therapy (including Povidone Iodine) versus topical fluoride monotherapy in preventing dental caries in children.
results_summary: The pooled analysis showed that combined therapy (including Povidone Iodine) was more effective than fluoride monotherapy in preventing dental caries, though the evidence was of low certainty and driven by studies on Xylitol.
population_specificity: Children aged 1 to 16 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of FDG PET/CT in managing thyroid cancer patients with BRAF mutations, particularly in guiding thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy decisions.
results_summary: The study suggests FDG PET/CT, especially under TSH stimulation, improves detection of metastatic and recurrent thyroid cancer. BRAFV600E mutations may indicate more aggressive disease, influencing therapeutic approaches like RAI therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer, particularly those with BRAF mutations and suspected metastatic/recurrent disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the thyroid response and incidence of dysfunction after iodine exposure during cardiac procedures in children.
results_summary: The study found a 15.4% incidence of acquired hypothyroidism after iodine exposure, mostly transient, with 84.6% of patients remaining euthyroid. Repeated interventions, certain drugs, and ICU treatment were strong predictors of thyroid dysfunction.
population_specificity: Neonates, infants, and children (median age 104 days, range 0-8 years) with congenital heart disease.
effective_dosage: Mean cumulative iodinated contrast load of 6.6 ± 1.6 mL/kg.
interactions: Drugs that interfere with thyroid function were noted as predictors of dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of prophylactic glucocorticoids in preventing adverse effects of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study is a planned clinical trial and does not yet report results; it will compare adverse effects and quality of life between patients receiving prophylactic glucocorticoids and those receiving placebo alongside RAI therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer referred for RAI therapy at the National Cancer Institute, Sri Lanka.
effective_dosage: Oral prednisolone 0.5 mg/kg and omeprazole 20 mg single dose 6 h before RAI therapy, followed by oral prednisolone 0.5 mg/kg and omeprazole 20 mg daily for 3 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of combined 1% alcoholic chlorhexidine gluconate and chlorhexidine gel-impregnated dressings (CGCD) versus 10% aqueous povidone-iodine and standard transparent dressings (PITD) in preventing catheter-related thrombosis (CRT) in critically ill patients.
results_summary: CGCD significantly reduced the incidence of early CRT (within 7 days) compared to PITD, but no significant effect was observed for late CRT (days 8-14).
population_specificity: Critically ill patients in an intensive care unit with central venous catheters inserted into the internal jugular vein for ≥48 hours.
study_duration: Follow-up period of up to 14 days post-catheter insertion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether using multiple micronutrient-fortified salt, including iodine, in school meals improved iron status in children.
results_summary: The study found no changes in urinary iodine levels in either the intervention or reference group, indicating that iodine supplementation via fortified salt did not significantly alter iodine status. However, iron status improved in the intervention group.
population_specificity: Schoolchildren aged 5-17 years in Tamil Nadu, India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether surgery alone achieves similar biochemical remission and improved quality of life compared to radioactive iodine ablation in low- to intermediate-risk papillary thyroid cancer patients.
results_summary: The study will compare biochemical remission rates and quality of life between patients who undergo surgery alone versus those who also receive radioactive iodine ablation, with results pending completion of the trial.
population_specificity: Patients with low- to intermediate-risk papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) who underwent total thyroidectomy.
effective_dosage: 131I (1.1 GBq for ablation; 0.074 to 0.222 GBq for diagnostic whole-body scan).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss recent FDA-approved treatments and potential future therapies for progressive metastatic thyroid cancers, including follicular cell-derived and medullary thyroid cancers.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that while new treatments have expanded options, complete remissions are rare, response durations are modest, and toxicities are common, emphasizing the need for further research on resistance mechanisms and biomarkers.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive metastatic follicular cell-derived and medullary thyroid cancers unresponsive to standard therapies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic accuracy of virtual unenhanced (VUE) CT images derived from dual-energy CT (DECT) with true unenhanced (TUE) CT images in abdominal imaging, particularly focusing on tissues with high iodine concentrations.
results_summary: The study found that VUE images showed significantly higher CT numbers (Hounsfield Units) in tissues containing iodine compared to TUE images, indicating potential limitations in replacing TUE for diagnostic purposes. Qualitative assessments also revealed inferior depiction of liver parenchyma and increased cortico-medullary differentiation in kidneys with VUE images.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing standard-of-care CT for pancreatic cancer (60 datasets reviewed).

study_goal: To assess the benefits and harms of antimicrobial mouthwashes and nasal sprays (including iodine) used by healthcare workers to protect themselves when treating COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: No completed studies were found for inclusion in the review. Three ongoing studies were identified, but their results were not yet available.
population_specificity: Healthcare workers treating patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if povidone-iodine 2.5% is effective in preventing ophthalmia neonatorum compared to no prophylaxis or other medications.
results_summary: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests povidone-iodine 2.5% may reduce the incidence of any aetiology conjunctivitis (ACAE), but evidence for its effect on gonococcal (GC), chlamydial (CC), or bacterial (BC) conjunctivitis was less certain. No significant adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Newborns in high-income and low- to middle-income settings.

study_goal: To evaluate the effect of a single preoperative administration of povidone-iodine (PVI) 10% plus levofloxacin 0.5% on reducing conjunctival flora before cataract surgery.
results_summary: The study found that a single adjuvant application of PVI 10% plus levofloxacin 0.5% significantly increased the rate of sterile conjunctiva preoperatively compared to the control group, with statistically significant reductions in positive cultures at T2 and T3.
population_specificity: Patients requiring cataract surgery at the Poostchi Ophthalmology Research Center, Shiraz, Iran.
effective_dosage: PVI 10% plus levofloxacin 0.5% eyedrops administered once at 1 hour preoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) as a definitive therapy for Graves disease (GD) and its associated orbitopathy (GO), comparing it with other treatments like thionamides and thyroidectomy.
results_summary: Radioactive iodine (RAI) is effective as a definitive therapy for GD, particularly for patients with persistent hyperthyroidism or relapse after methimazole treatment, but should be avoided in patients with active GO, especially smokers.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves disease (GD) and associated Graves orbitopathy (GO).
interactions: Avoid in patients with active GO, especially smokers. None mentioned with medications, foods, or other supplements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 0.2% Povidone-Iodine gargle and nasal lavage against other solutions in reducing intra-oral viral load and assessing salivary cytokine profiles in COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as the study is described as a planned pilot trial with no outcome data reported.
population_specificity: Laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 positive patients (18-65 years, mild to moderate disease) admitted to Aga Khan University Hospital, excluding those with severe conditions or pre-existing chronic mucosal lesions.
effective_dosage: 10 ml of 0.2% Povidone-Iodine gargle and nasal lavage, thrice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of povidone-iodine as a nasal disinfectant against SARS-CoV-2, focusing on its viricidal effects and mechanisms of action.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine demonstrated in vitro viricidal effects against SARS-CoV-2, with oxidant activity as its primary mechanism of action. However, no randomized controlled clinical trials have tested its efficacy against SARS-CoV-2 in humans.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and general context of nasal disinfectants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 10% povidone-iodine for skin preparation reduces surgical site infection (SSI) compared to 2% alcoholic chlorhexidine in patients undergoing abdominal surgery in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).
results_summary: The study compares 10% povidone-iodine to 2% alcoholic chlorhexidine for skin preparation, but the abstract does not report specific results for iodine's efficacy. The primary outcome is SSI at 30 days, with the study designed to influence international clinical guidelines.
population_specificity: Patients in LMICs undergoing abdominal surgery with clean-contaminated or contaminated/dirty wounds and abdominal skin incision ≥ 5 cm.
study_duration: Single application at the time of surgery, with follow-up for 30 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the outcomes of balloon PTA for hemodialysis shunts using CO2-DSA versus conventional iodine contrast medium (C-DSA) in terms of vessel patency.
results_summary: The study found that CO2-DSA and C-DSA had similar secondary patency rates (94.1% vs. 93.9%) at 24 months, with no major complications in the CO2 group and one blood vessel injury in the C-DSA group. Clinical success rates were high for both methods (100% for CO2-DSA, 96.5% for C-DSA).
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients (76 total, 38 males and 38 females, mean age 65.0±14.0 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the evidence for the efficacy of MEBO (containing iodine) compared to other treatments in managing partial-thickness burn wounds.
results_summary: MEBO showed improved wound healing compared to SSD in two of three trials and possibly vs. povidone-iodine + bepanthenol cream, but no difference was found compared to Acquacel Ag.
population_specificity: Adults and children with partial-thickness burns.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the importance of dental evaluation and treatment for patients undergoing radioiodine therapy to prevent oral complications and systemic infections.
results_summary: The study found that untreated dental issues can lead to systemic complications in patients receiving radioiodine therapy, emphasizing the need for thorough dental check-ups and appropriate treatment before and after therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer undergoing radioiodine treatment.

study_goal: To compare the efficacy and safety of iodine-125 seed interstitial brachytherapy versus local chemotherapy perfusion in treating advanced pancreatic cancer.
results_summary: Iodine-125 brachytherapy showed higher partial remission rates, lower pain scores, improved Karnofsky scores, reduced tumor markers (CA19-9, CA50), and longer overall survival compared to chemotherapy perfusion, with no significant adverse events reported.
population_specificity: 165 advanced pancreatic cancer patients.
study_duration: Follow-up at 1 day, 7 days, 14 days, 1 month, 2 months, and 3 months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine whether iodine-containing mouthwashes (povidone-iodine, PVP-I) could reduce SARS-CoV-2 transmission in the oral cavity.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that mouthwashes, including povidone-iodine, may reduce microorganisms in the oral cavity, but there is no clinical evidence yet that they prevent SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
population_specificity: Not specified (implied dental patients or healthcare settings).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various disinfectants, including povidone-iodine, in preventing SARS-CoV-2 contamination, particularly in open wounds.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine could be recommended for SARS-CoV-2 contamination risks, especially for open wounds, alongside other disinfectants like bleach and alcohol.
population_specificity: Health care facilities and environments with potential SARS-CoV-2 contamination.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine baseline iodine status and assess the effect of lean-seafood versus non-seafood diets on urinary iodine concentration (UIC), plasma selenium, and arsenic levels.
results_summary: The lean-seafood intervention significantly increased UIC and plasma selenium, while also raising urinary and plasma arsenic levels. The non-seafood intervention did not affect UIC but decreased plasma selenium.
population_specificity: 20 participants (7 males, 13 females) with a mean age of 50.6 ± 15.3 years.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary intervention with 60% of total proteins from lean-seafood or non-seafood).
study_duration: Two 4-week experimental periods separated by a 5-week washout.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the capabilities of multienergy CT technologies to distinguish tissues and materials beyond conventional CT.
results_summary: The abstract describes multienergy CT technologies, including dual-source, rapid tube-voltage switching, and dual-layer detector CT, which use differential attenuation at distinct energy spectra to enhance material and tissue distinction.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical-pathological findings and treatment outcomes of unusual metastases in differentiated thyroid cancer patients, focusing on the role of iodine-based diagnostic and therapeutic approaches.
results_summary: The study found that unusual metastases in differentiated thyroid cancer are rare and often metachronous, with most cases involving radioiodine-refractory disease. Treatment with tyrosine kinase inhibitors like lenvatinib showed stable disease or partial response in some patients.
population_specificity: Differentiated thyroid cancer patients with unusual metastases in Korea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of antenatal multiple micronutrient (MM) supplementation, including iodine, on newborn micronutrient status compared to iron folic acid (IFA) supplementation in rural Bangladesh.
results_summary: The study found that maternal iodine status (measured via thyroglobulin and free thyroxine) positively correlated with newborn iodine biomarkers, suggesting improved iodine transfer to the fetus with better maternal status. The MM intervention did not significantly alter iodine biomarkers compared to IFA, but maternal iodine status was a key mediator of newborn levels.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and their newborns in rural Bangladesh.
effective_dosage: Not specified (MM and IFA formulations contained the same IFA content, but iodine dosage was not detailed).
study_duration: Supplementation occurred from early pregnancy until delivery (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to address the impacts of COVID-19 on thyroid cancer diagnosis, treatment planning, and specific concerns regarding interactions between the virus, its treatments, and cancer.
results_summary: The study highlights delays in thyroid cancer diagnosis due to COVID-19, the need for adjusted treatment planning to mitigate nosocomial transmission risks, and specific concerns about virus-treatment-cancer interactions. It provides guidance for patients and colleagues during the pandemic.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer and healthcare professionals during the COVID-19 pandemic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of a broad-spectrum multinutrient formula (including iodine) versus an active control (iodine and riboflavin) for treating depression and anxiety in pregnant women and assessing infant health outcomes.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results regarding iodine's effects, as it describes a study protocol rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Pregnant women aged over 16 years, between 12-24 weeks gestation, with EPDS scores ≥13.
effective_dosage: Not specified (active control contained iodine and riboflavin, but exact dosage not mentioned).
study_duration: 12 weeks (with optional open-label phase until birth).

study_goal: To assess the feasibility and tumor outcomes of re-irradiation with low-dose-rate brachytherapy using Iodine-125 seeds for local recurrences after prostatectomy and external beam radiation therapy.
results_summary: The study found that focal local recurrence brachytherapy with Iodine-125 seeds was technically feasible and safe, but efficacy was uncertain as most patients relapsed quickly at other sites.
population_specificity: Five men with histologically proven local recurrence after prostatectomy and adjuvant or salvage external beam radiation therapy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (low-dose-rate brachytherapy with Iodine-125 seeds).
study_duration: Not specified (median delay after EBRT was 86 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of different skin antiseptics, including iodine-based solutions (PVI), in preventing surgical site infections in clean surgery.
results_summary: Alcoholic CHG 4%-5% was found to be twice as effective as PVI (both alcoholic and aqueous solutions) in preventing surgical site infections, with adverse events only observed in patients exposed to PVI.
population_specificity: Adults undergoing clean surgery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (focus on formulations: aqueous PVI and alcoholic PVI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether radioactive iodine treatment for hyperthyroidism is associated with an increased risk of subsequent malignancy and mortality.
results_summary: One study found no association between radioactive iodine and increased solid tumor risk, while another reported a dose-dependent increase in solid tumor mortality. Data remain inconsistent.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of dual-energy CT (DECT) in identifying and quantifying iodine for the assessment of diffuse liver diseases and hepatocellular carcinoma.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that DECT enables accurate identification and quantification of iodine, among other materials, but does not provide specific results on iodine's effects. The study reviews literature on DECT's potential in liver disease assessment but does not detail iodine-specific outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with diffuse liver diseases and hepatocellular carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on antithyroid medications, including iodine, for treating hyperthyroidism during pregnancy and breastfeeding.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on iodine's effects, focusing instead on PTU, CMZ, and MMI, with mixed evidence on congenital anomalies and safety profiles.
population_specificity: Pregnant and breastfeeding women with hyperthyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the challenges and potential solutions for radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory thyroid cancer, focusing on redifferentiation strategies and dosimetry to improve I-131 therapy efficacy.
results_summary: The study found that targeted therapies like BRAF and MEK inhibitors can re-induce RAI uptake in RAI-refractory thyroid cancer, enabling I-131 therapy. Dosimetry before and after treatment helps quantify uptake and optimize therapeutic dosing for better outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-refractory thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the risk of breast cancer as a second primary malignancy after radioiodine treatment (RAI) for differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), particularly in females treated at a young age.
results_summary: The study found a low general breast cancer risk (~2%) in adult DTC survivors, slightly higher in females than males, and likely lower in those diagnosed as children or adolescents. RAI did not substantially influence breast cancer risk, but data for young patients were insufficient for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Females with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) treated with RAI in childhood, adolescence, or young adulthood.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of povidone-iodine and other irrigant solutions in reducing bacterial contamination on breast implant surfaces.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine demonstrated the greatest efficacy, reducing bacterial load by a factor of 10 to 10 for all tested strains of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus epidermidis.
population_specificity: In vitro study using bacterial strains and sterile silicone implant disks.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the diagnostic utility of iodine-123-meta-iodobenzylguanidine in differentiating adrenal medullary hyperplasia from pheochromocytoma.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects, only mentioning its use in diagnostic imaging.
population_specificity: 48-year-old Hispanic woman with resistant hypertension and suspected pheochromocytoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic performance of iodine-131-labeled MIBG and gallium-68-labeled DOTANOC PET/CT in patients with pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma, and to assess germline mutations in histopathologically confirmed cases.
results_summary: [I]MIBG detected 41 lesions in 34 patients, while [Ga]DOTANOC PET/CT detected more than 79 lesions in 55 patients, suggesting superior diagnostic efficacy for the latter. Germline mutations were identified in 8 out of 16 tested patients, including novel mutations in SDHB and MDH2 genes.
population_specificity: 106 patients (61 men; mean age 38.5 ± 16.2 years) with known or suspected pheochromocytoma/paraganglioma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent developments in understanding Hashimoto's thyroiditis as a risk factor for thyroid cancer, particularly in areas with sufficient iodine intake.
results_summary: The study found an increased prevalence of both Hashimoto's thyroiditis and thyroid cancer, suggesting that the inflammatory process in Hashimoto's may be a risk factor for thyroid cancer. It also highlighted limitations in current diagnostic approaches and called for updated guidelines when lymphocytic infiltration is present.
population_specificity: Individuals with Hashimoto's thyroiditis and/or thyroid cancer, particularly in regions with sufficient iodine intake.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iodinated contrast media in CT imaging, their safety and efficacy, and explore future alternatives like iodine-free contrast media.
results_summary: The study found that iodinated contrast media are effective and safe for CT imaging, though they can cause adverse reactions. Future developments may include iodine-free alternatives to benefit patients with specific sensitivities or thyroid disorders.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing CT scans or interventional angiography.

study_goal: The researchers were comparing the efficacy and safety of two different injection techniques (intradermal multiple punctures vs. subcutaneous radial approach) for administering incobotulinumtoxin A (IncoA) in treating axillary hyperhidrosis, not iodine.
results_summary: The study found that both injection techniques significantly reduced sweat production, with 95% of patients achieving ≥50% reduction after 30 days. Multiple punctures showed slightly better outcomes at certain time points, but both methods were effective and well-tolerated.
population_specificity: 24 patients with severe axillary hyperhidrosis (67% female, mean age 34.7 years).
effective_dosage: 50 U of incobotulinumtoxin A per axilla.
study_duration: Follow-up visits at 30, 120, 180, and 270 days post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the role and efficacy of radioactive iodine (RAI) adjuvant therapy in patients with T1-3N1b papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC).
results_summary: The study found that the recurrence rate was higher in patients who underwent surgery with RAI adjuvant therapy (24.2%) compared to surgery alone (7.1%). The difference in recurrence rates may be attributed to the RAI group having larger tumors and more lymph node metastases at baseline.
population_specificity: Patients with T1-3N1bM0 PTC who underwent complete resection, excluding those with bilateral PTC.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pathophysiological, clinical, and therapeutic aspects of skeletal fragility in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) due to TSH-suppressive therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights that TSH-suppressive therapy in DTC patients can lead to bone resorption, bone loss, and increased fracture risk, with potential exacerbation when cancer cells localize to the skeleton. Management of skeletal fragility in these patients remains challenging due to uncertain fracture prediction and limited data on bone-active agents' effectiveness.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) undergoing TSH-suppressive therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iron deficiency in hair loss and assess the reliability of available tests for iron deficiency.
results_summary: The study found conflicting results regarding iron's role in hair loss, attributing discrepancies to limitations in iron deficiency assays. It discusses the sensitivity and specificity of current tests and provides guidelines for testing and supplementation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on iron deficiency and hair loss)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize progress in using nanotechnology, particularly iron oxide nanoparticles, for tracking implanted cells in living subjects.
results_summary: The study highlights that iron oxide nanoparticles enable non-invasive, real-time tracking of implanted cells with high spatial and temporal resolution, offering advantages over traditional histological methods. It also discusses ferritin and MagA reporter genes for packaging endogenous iron or supplements into nanoparticles.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on cell-based therapeutics and nanotechnology applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review diagnostic and therapeutic strategies for iron deficiency anemia (IDA) in patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), focusing on iron homeostasis and supplementation methods.
results_summary: The study found that oral iron supplementation in IBD may cause gastrointestinal adverse effects and disease exacerbation, leading to current guidelines recommending intravenous iron supplementation instead. New indices of iron metabolism may improve the assessment of iron status in IBD patients.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and iron deficiency anemia (IDA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of iron supplementation for treating anemia in patients with congestive heart failure (CHF) and its impact on symptoms and functional status.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that numerous clinical studies have examined iron supplementation for anemia in CHF patients, but no clear superiority of this approach has been established. Data from large randomized trials on the effect of anemia correction on patient outcomes are still lacking.
population_specificity: Patients with congestive heart failure (CHF) and anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether iron supplementation, compared to folate alone, improves hematologic recovery in children treated for acute malaria.
results_summary: Iron supplementation (2 mg/kg/day) plus folate (5 mg/day) significantly improved hematocrit levels compared to folate alone after four weeks. Baseline hematocrit, iron supplementation, weight for height, and weekly meat intake were significant predictors of final hematocrit.
population_specificity: Children aged 6-60 months from Nigeria with smear-positive malaria and anemia (hematocrit < 33%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the relationship between iron deficiency and nonscarring scalp alopecia in women and explore potential iron-dependent genes in hair follicles.
results_summary: The study reviewed existing literature but found mixed evidence on the link between iron deficiency and nonscarring alopecia, highlighting limitations such as small sample sizes and lack of randomized controlled trials. It suggested further research on iron's role in the hair cycle and clinical trials on iron supplementation for affected women.
population_specificity: Women with nonscarring scalp alopecia and low iron stores.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the desirable and undesirable effects of iron and folic acid supplementation in iron-deficient anemic women.
results_summary: Iron supplementation significantly improved hemoglobin levels and certain antioxidant enzymes but increased oxidative stress markers and decreased some antioxidant vitamins. Side effects were more pronounced in mild anemic groups but were generally negligible.
population_specificity: 117 iron-deficient anemic women (mild, moderate, and severe) and 60 non-anemic controls.
effective_dosage: 100 mg/day iron (as ferrous sulphate) and 500 μg/day folic acid.

study_goal: To assess the efficacy of Sprinkles, a micronutrient supplement containing iron, in the primary prevention of anemia in infants with free access to healthcare.
results_summary: Hemoglobin levels >11 g/dl were found in 55% of Bedouin and 40% of Jewish infants, with Bedouin infants showing significantly lower serum iron, folic acid, and zinc levels. The study found no clinically significant differences in hematologic and micronutrient indicators between the intervention and control arms.
population_specificity: 6-month-old Bedouin and Jewish infants in southern Israel attending Mother and Child Health clinics.
effective_dosage: Not specified (daily dose of Sprinkles containing iron, vitamins A and C, folic acid, and zinc).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between renal anemia, oxidative stress, and the effects of intravenous iron supplementation in end-stage renal disease patients.
results_summary: The study suggests that renal anemia itself is a major contributor to oxidative stress, and intravenous iron may further exacerbate oxidative stress in chronic kidney disease patients. Future trials are needed to confirm these effects on patient outcomes.
population_specificity: End-stage renal disease patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanisms and treatment of rheumatoid anemia, focusing on the roles of iron metabolism, hepcidin, and IL-6.
results_summary: The study found that rheumatoid anemia is linked to hepcidin overexpression driven by IL-6, which disrupts iron metabolism and erythropoiesis. IL-6 antagonists and optimal disease control were highlighted as promising treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis and associated anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between iron depletion and diffuse hair loss in long-term parenteral nutrition patients, particularly those at higher risk of anemia.
results_summary: The study suggests a potential link between iron depletion and hair loss in home parenteral nutrition patients, recommending a serum ferritin level of 70 μg/l as a target when hair loss is unexplained. However, there is limited data showing cessation of hair loss with iron therapy, and insufficient evidence to recommend iron supplementation in non-anemic patients.
population_specificity: Long-term parenteral nutrition patients, particularly those at higher risk of anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the broader effects of iron deficiency beyond anemia, including its impact on brain development, immunity, and associations with various disorders.
results_summary: The study found that iron deficiency has significant adverse effects on brain development, cognitive function, and immunity, with some effects potentially irreversible if occurring during early childhood. It also noted inconsistent findings on iron deficiency's role in infection susceptibility and an increased risk of malaria with iron supplementation in endemic regions.
population_specificity: General population, with specific focus on children under 2 years and individuals in malaria-endemic regions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether iron supplementation benefits marginally low birth weight (MLBW) infants by reducing the risk of iron deficiency (ID) and iron deficiency anemia (IDA).
results_summary: Iron supplementation significantly improved hemoglobin and iron status indicators in a dose-dependent manner, reducing ID prevalence from 36% (placebo) to 3.8% (2 mg/kg/day) and IDA from 9.9% to 0%. No adverse effects on growth or morbidity were observed.
population_specificity: Healthy, marginally low birth weight infants (2000-2500 g).
study_duration: From 6 weeks to 6 months of age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and acceptability of different iron-based strategies (supplements and fortified foods) for treating anemia in non-breastfed children.
results_summary: All treatments significantly increased hemoglobin and total iron levels, with iron supplements (IS, IFS, MMS) showing greater improvements than fortified complementary food (FCF). Micronutrient-containing supplements (IFS, MMS) were more effective at reducing anemia prevalence, though fortified foods were better accepted by children.
population_specificity: Non-breastfed children aged 6 to 43 months with anemia (hemoglobin < 11.7 g/dL).
effective_dosage: Daily doses included iron supplement (20 mg), iron+folic acid (12.5 mg), multiple micronutrient supplement (10 mg), fortified complementary food (10 mg), and fortified water (6.7 mg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the impact of iron-folic acid supplementation on maternal mortality and its effectiveness in trials and large-scale programs.
results_summary: Iron-folic acid supplementation increases hemoglobin levels by 1.17 g/dL in developed countries and 1.13 g/dL in developing countries, reducing maternal anemia prevalence by one-third to one-half over a decade. Anemia underlies 115,000 maternal deaths annually, with supplementation showing potential to significantly reduce mortality.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, particularly in Africa and Asia where anemia prevalence is high.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of oral iron supplementation on hematological and iron metabolism parameters in elite soccer players.
results_summary: Iron supplementation (80 mg/day for 3 weeks) significantly increased serum iron, ferritin, transferrin saturation, hematocrit, and mean corpuscular volume in elite soccer players compared to the control group. A higher percentage of supplemented players had ferritin levels above upper limits, while the control group had more instances of ferritin below lower limits.
population_specificity: Elite soccer players (Spanish Premier League and Third Division League teams).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the compliance of physicians and nurses with iron supplementation recommendations for their own children and routine child health care practices.
results_summary: The study found poor compliance with iron supplementation among medical personnel, particularly physicians, with only 41.2% rating their compliance as 6 or less on a 0-10 scale. Nurses were significantly more compliant than physicians (54.9% vs. 32.4%).
population_specificity: Physicians and nurses from Haifa and Tel Aviv working in hospitals and community settings.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the management of Cronkhite-Canada syndrome, including the use of oral micronutrient supplementation (iron, vitamins A, E, D, and a multivitamin).
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effects of iron supplementation, only mentioning its inclusion in the treatment regimen.
population_specificity: A 72-year-old man with Cronkhite-Canada syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic tests for iron deficiency and the efficacy and safety of intravenous iron therapy in heart failure patients, including those with and without anemia.
results_summary: Intravenous iron replenished iron stores, increased hemoglobin levels, and improved functional capacity in heart failure patients with iron-deficiency anemia. Preliminary data also suggested improved functional capacity in non-anemic subjects, possibly due to enhanced mitochondrial respiration in skeletal muscle. However, long-term safety concerns were noted, including potential pro-oxidant effects and vascular dysfunction.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure (HF), including those with and without iron-deficiency anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of oral lactoferrin versus intravenous iron, both combined with rHuEPO, for treating anemia in advanced cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Both oral lactoferrin and intravenous iron, combined with rHuEPO, significantly increased hemoglobin levels with no difference in efficacy between the two treatments. Ferritin levels decreased with lactoferrin but increased with intravenous iron.
population_specificity: 148 advanced cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy
effective_dosage: Ferric gluconate (125 mg i.v. weekly) or lactoferrin (200 mg/day)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the importance of iron supplementation in preventing gestational anemia and its associated complications.
results_summary: The study found that gestational anemia is a significant public health issue, primarily caused by iron deficiency, and that oral iron supplementation is strongly recommended for pregnant women in developing countries to address this deficiency and improve maternal and fetal outcomes.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, particularly in developing countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess iron status in breastfed infants compared to formula-fed infants and evaluate the risk of iron deficiency during infancy.
results_summary: Breastfed infants had lower iron intake and higher rates of iron deficiency (21%) and iron deficiency anemia (up to 6%) compared to formula-fed infants, who maintained adequate iron status. Early iron supplementation via complementary foods was recommended to prevent deficiency.
population_specificity: Infants fully breastfed or fed iron-fortified formula during the first 4 months of life.
effective_dosage: Not specified (iron intake was assessed but not controlled).
study_duration: Follow-up at 4, 7, and 10 months of age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether orange juice (containing ascorbic acid) enhances iron absorption from ferrous fumarate compared to apple juice (no ascorbic acid) in children.
results_summary: Iron absorption from ferrous fumarate increased significantly (5.5% to 8.2%) when given with orange juice versus apple juice, with the effect being more pronounced in children older than 6 years. The enhancement was positively correlated with height, weight, and age.
population_specificity: 21 children aged 4.0 to 7.9 years.
effective_dosage: 4 mg Fe as ferrous fumarate in a muffin, consumed with either apple or orange juice.
study_duration: Not specified (crossover design implies short-term intervention).
interactions: Ascorbic acid in orange juice enhanced iron absorption from ferrous fumarate.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether co-administration of DFAIII with water-insoluble iron improves iron absorption and treats iron deficiency anemia more effectively than iron alone in anemic Vietnamese women.
results_summary: Co-administration of DFAIII with iron significantly increased hemoglobin levels and iron stores compared to iron alone, with Group B (iron + DFAIII) showing a twofold greater increase in body iron than Group A (iron alone). The percentage of anemia was also significantly reduced in Group B compared to placebo and Group A.
population_specificity: Moderately anemic Vietnamese women (hemoglobin 80-120 g/L).
effective_dosage: 15 mg Fe as ferric pyrophosphate or ferrous sulfate, with or without 1.25 g DFAIII, daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if simvastatin could influence serum prohepcidin levels in hemodialysis patients, potentially addressing iron deficiency and ESA resistance.
results_summary: The study found that simvastatin did not significantly alter serum prohepcidin, CRP, or IL-6 levels in hemodialysis patients, though it reduced cholesterol and triglyceride levels. Iron-related markers (ferritin, hemoglobin) remained unchanged.
population_specificity: Maintenance hemodialysis patients (33 subjects) and healthy adults (19 subjects as controls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of iron supplementation, alone and combined with vitamins, on hematological status, oxidative stress, and erythrocyte membrane fluidity in anemic pregnant women.
results_summary: Iron supplementation significantly improved hemoglobin and ferritin levels, reduced oxidative stress markers, and increased erythrocyte membrane fluidity, with the greatest improvements seen when iron was combined with vitamins.
population_specificity: Anemic pregnant women (n=164)
effective_dosage: 60 mg Fe (ferrous sulphate) daily; combinations included 400 μg folic acid (group IF) or 2 mg retinol and 1 mg riboflavin (group IM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether iron supplementation was associated with an increased risk of community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) in hospitalized older adults, adjusting for known risk factors.
results_summary: The study found no significant association between iron supplementation and the risk of CAP, as indicated by the adjusted odds ratio (AOR) being part of the confounders but not highlighted as a significant risk factor.
population_specificity: Adults aged 65 years or older hospitalized in a rural community hospital during 2004 and 2006, excluding those with specific conditions like gastric tube feeding or metastatic diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence of micronutrient deficiencies, including iron, in nonpregnant rural and tribal women aged 18-30 in central India.
results_summary: The study found that 66% of women had low hemoglobin levels (<120 g/L), indicating iron deficiency anemia. Tribal women had a higher prevalence of concurrent micronutrient deficiencies, including zinc and anemia.
population_specificity: Nonpregnant rural and tribal women aged 18-30 from central India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if intermittent treatment with sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine (SP) combined with iron supplementation could reduce the recurrence of moderate or severe anaemia in Gambian children with prior anaemia episodes.
results_summary: The study found that SP did not significantly reduce anaemia recurrence but effectively prevented malaria. Iron supplementation, combined with antimalarial treatment and healthcare access, restored haemoglobin levels acceptably.
population_specificity: Gambian children with moderate or severe anaemia (Hb <7 g/dL) during malaria transmission seasons.
effective_dosage: Oral iron for 28 days (specific dosage not mentioned).
study_duration: 28 days of iron supplementation, with SP or placebo administered monthly until the end of the malaria transmission season.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether short-course oral FeSO4 supplementation (2-3 weeks) significantly improves pre-operative hemoglobin levels in colorectal cancer patients.
results_summary: Short-term FeSO4 supplementation significantly increased hemoglobin levels (mean gain of 1.73 g/dl, P<0.001), particularly in patients with right-sided tumors and presenting anemia. The transfusion rate for curative resections decreased from 1.69 to 0.69 units/patient compared to a historical cohort.
population_specificity: Patients with colorectal cancer undergoing surgery (n=117, with 14 excluded).
effective_dosage: 200 mg three times daily (tds) of FeSO4.
